alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 08 at 6:42PM EDT until July 08 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Northeastern Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Miller County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 745 PM EDT/645 PM CDT/. * At 641 PM EDT/541 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Columbia to 9 miles southeast of Ashford to 7 miles southwest of Cottonwood, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Graceville, Donalsonville, Marianna, Dothan, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Kinsey, Malone, Rehobeth, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Iron City and Campbellton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
